title: Solace In Slumber
excerpt: I feel no color, I never did. Blue’s been my bower since birth, A ghost before the grave. Even the wind’s whirl could not wither My scent, my shape.
imageAlt: Abstract close-up of a dark, textured surface, possibly a black feather or wing, evoking mystery and gloom.
contentMarkdown:
I feel no color, I never did.
Blue’s been my bower since birth,
A ghost before the grave.
Even the wind’s whirl could not wither
My scent, my shape.
I go to sleep, wishing
To die-
Yearning to exhale out my life,
In a snore, through my nose.
I go to sleep- barehanded
In a slovenly supine pose
Death lulls its lucid lullaby
A bit before I bail out to sleep
Snuggles around me sly,
Shelters me in its arms
Cuddles me tenderly,
Beneath a blanket of relief
The twin sister of life’s
She lingers, watches and gathers all:
Wishes for slumber, sighs of strife,
A stockpile of restless souls
So innocent, free of foul.
A candle’s flame while it glows
Burns itself, and it knows:
To live is to die,
Briskly to breathe between bale
Through dusk and through its veil
I wake up between the hours,
Only to find myself
Afloat above my ashen body
Still lies the body,
Trapped in the coffin of life.
I look around, only to find
A black feather in my hands.
I wish to move, and succeed
But begin to fall and flail, grotesquely,
Down into a chasm of black gloom.
plummeting down, I scream
Into the void, yet make no sound
I weep. I snort.
And finally, I crash and snap
Onto the floor.
I open my eyes only to unearth
Myself dropped off the bed
looming over the floor
Gasping and sobbing, I plead with my lungs
Through the unsettling stillness,
My sight falls upon,
A black feather, away afoot my body from

title: The River Bank
excerpt: Read the heartbraking tale of the narattor, which will make you question your decesions, but most importantly, it will make u question ur memories, specially the ones you have built ur life around.
contentMarkdown:
The stream ran bright,
Water paving away by
Tap dancing with sunlight
Like gilded coins glittered around
For tiny souls that knew no bound For having returned,
With me, my memories
A gust of wind blows,
Through the trees, birds and the bees
And swiftly Knocking off,
The worries, alarms and the bills
They dive deep down onto...
The pristine glassy stream Greeting the old friend with cold regards
It waves back at my feet...
Looking down upon,
No ripple of recognition beneath the surface
Withered since we last met
With me, my innocence
The part of me
That made a good friend
What remains now is foreign--
Stranger even to myself
I don't blame it for not recalling
How could it discern me now,
when I no longer do You would sink to such a self if u tried --
Dipping into the arms of the river...
I threw a stone, a heavy large one
Dragged down by the drift
Right where we once swirled
around our limbs There used to be a cottonwood here...
Goldfinches swirling bright
Right here, where we leaped
A body fluent in it's own desire
No, not here, upon pondering
maybe right here, where we swiped
The sunlit dust off the bank
right onto our brows, the sunlit dust
once we called joy
reminiscing now, it used to be
right here, where we kept
all our secrets unfurled, conspiring,
All the ways we would mold our time
Into castles of sand,
only to be swept away,
Kingdoms never meant to last anyways Seeds of gold and goldfinches that flinched them,
were meant to reed away
for cottonwood that would spring far later
then memory recalled anyways,
For we, by then,
would wither away into dust along by the riverbank, with the dust
all the seeds that remain unflinched
And be the shade for all the tiny souls
That would partake in raising
The castles and kingdoms fated to dissolve anyways For having found
Warmth and solace
the world had snatched and swallowed.
Hugging the old pal,
There's comfort in its grasp.
Not to retreat and relent,
but to accept and forgo—
To sink sweetly,
for the freedom below.
Let the surrender feel like flight,
A dream finally fulifilled:

To fly away,
Oh so far,
Oh so far, forgone and beyond all filth.

title: So, you want to travel back
excerpt: "So, you want to travel back, for you could not contain, could not refrain, that boundless hunger deep within, For all the changes you could pinch..." Like a hawk that couldn’t be caged anymore...
contentMarkdown:
` Context: We all sometime in our life have had an ick to go back and fix all our shortcomings.
Set in the distant future, the time traveller has set out on a journey to fix all the mistakes he made,
unbeknownst to him the deterministic nature of universe grapples him in it's loop for eternity.
For they shall never grow out of thier desperate want to travel back.


\"So, you want to travel back,
for you could not contain,
could not refrain,
that boundless hunger deep within,
For all the changes you could pinch,

So, you want to travel back,
to gain control that with time lost,
for all mistakes that bore a heavy cost,
reassure the freedom thereafter,
stripping off all thy past disasters,

So, you want to travel back,
For all the changes you could etch,
for all harmony that would cling,
from Serenity you longed to fetch,
from the compassion that you'd bring,

Like a hawk that couldn’t be caged anymore Like tending a wound that couldn’t be restored Like gazing at beauty that can’t be mirrored

And, So, you will travel back,
to arrive as peaceful as still marine water,
to garner stillness, that of a weaver,
whose final thread is laid,
with all the glory and praises,
that reality relentlessly raises, So, you will travel back,
For the cosmic loom to set itself,
linear as it ever was,
for thy doomed fate to let itself,
bound as tight as ever was, So, you will travel back,
never truly to embrace,
to forever unknowingly interlace,
the desperate want to travel back\" `

title: The Cost of Belonging
excerpt: Was I born different? What did I do different that made me the way I am? These are some of the questions that rebels like myself ask themselves at some point in life, probably after realizing how fucked up the world really is...
imageAlt: Abstract circular design with purple and black elements, possibly album art
contentMarkdown:
` Was I born different?
What did I do different that made me the way I am? These are some of the questions that rebels like myself ask themselves at some point in life, probably after realizing how fucked up the world really is and how much control you really have, can’t put an age up at this, it’s different for everyone. This might just also be the time that we find ourselves a bit more depressed than usual and start looking out for those tiny moments of happiness since life isn’t playdough anymore. We might find ourselves having thoughts of travelling back through time to when things were simpler, when we were not as rebellious as we are right now. Let’s define our terms, shall we? What do I mean by a ‘rebel’ and being ‘rebellious’? See I like to believe that the world is divided into two kinds of people, the usual sheep-like ‘Conformists’ and the ever changing, fed up with the system, ‘Rebels’ **Why Are We Raised to Obey, Not to Think?** Why is it that as kids—and even as teens—we’re never really taught how to *think*? We're only taught how to *obey*. Respect your elders. Follow the rules. Conformity is the default setting, especially enforced by family and state. Parents are given a blank slate the moment we’re born. They can raise a rebel… or shape a command-obeying conformist. So, here’s the question:
**What’s right or wrong with either of these ideologies?**
And the deeper one—**how long can someone truly stay in a conformist state before cracking?** These questions unravel more beneath them. Which idea of liberation deserves more value? How much influence do parents really hold over the wiring of a child’s identity? Let’s address the first question. Anyone with a functioning brain, basic observational skills, and even a hint of logic *should* already know the answer—given the world we live in today. Let me be blunt: I’m heavily biased. I’m a free soul. I despise authority of any kind. I believe a man of logic should follow reasoning, *not* orders. And no, this isn’t some utopian delusion. We don't live in an ideal world. Anyone who's grown out of their childhood innocence can *see* it. It doesn't stop with just your own country—look around, dig deeper. You'll arrive at the same conclusion:
**Everyone. Everywhere. Is messed up.** Society, globally, is broken. And here’s the part that stings: the majority of it is made up of *conformists*. Look at Trump’s re-election. Look at a Chai-wala’s turned supreme leader riding the wave of blind devotion for over a decade. If that’s not enough to blame the downfall on mass conformity, I don’t know what is. And rebels?
What do a handful of rebels even achieve—except martyrdom? History has Proof. Narendra Dabholkar. Gauri Lankesh. Journalists. Whistleblowers. Silenced. Gunned down. Forgotten. Most conformists don’t even *know* about their sacrifices. Some days, I find myself genuinely believing that this world mostly comprises of and run by retards. Is it really that hard to not get brainwashed?
To hold an objective thought before buying into something?
To question *anything* you encounter? Apparently, for most—it is. And that’s terrifying. Another question we don’t ask enough:
**How much damage do cover-ups, lies, and secrecy cause when authorities mess up?**
Maybe I’ll dig into that next time. But for now, let me say this: *Conformity*—as a global disease—should be viewed with the same suspicion we reserve for *communism* (or any ideology when taken to the extreme). The world would be better off without blind followers. And here comes the final—and maybe trickiest—question:
**How long can one stay a conformist? And how much of that is because of parenting?** In my case, both my parents are conformists. The only rebellion they seem to show is *towards me*. They’ve never been the curious type. Never stirred trouble. Unless something extreme happens—or someone they care about is at risk—they’ll stay quiet. Safe. Predictable. By that logic, I should’ve turned out exactly like them. But I didn’t. I’m the polar opposite. I question *everything*. I overthink *everything*.
Why? Probably because I surrounded myself with… *no one*.
No friends. Just books. YouTube. My own thoughts. Isolation breeds introspection. This needs to be studied more, honestly. I can’t draw conclusions from just one case. But if I had to bet—I'd say rebels are born this way. I was fed the same ideas as everyone else. But something in me rejected them all. And here I am. `

title: [POEM] Time Flies By
excerpt: Time flies by / For me it does so in gloom / Worries of the future / Regrets of the past / Time flies by / With the tick of the clocks / An infinite race / With no finish line to cross...
imageAlt: Solid purple logo with stylized letters AG
contentMarkdown:
` Time flies by
For me it does so in gloom
Worries of the future
Regrets of the past Time flies by
With the tick of the clocks
An infinite race
With no finish line to cross Time flies by
It lingers , it haunts
Summer's chill , winter's warmth
A fleeting act of taunts Time flies by
As I sit through my thoughts
Both of the cruel and kind
Unable to fill the void in my life's mere plot Time flies by
In it's flight , I write
Words to compose myself
For the life I hope to strive.
`

title: [POST] Reading
excerpt: I was thinking about the way I like to read , I read 3 different kinds of books at the same time. One book must be thought provoking... One book must be fictional... One book should be non fiction... Personally the one's I love the most are stories that teach something valuable...
imageAlt: Stylized purple letter A logo with sharp edges
contentMarkdown:
` I was thinking about the way I like to read , I read 3 different kinds of books at the same time. One book must be thought provoking , that instills ideas , makes u question ur absolute thoughts , One I'm reading right now is Metamorphosis
One book must be fictional , just a good story that is enjoyable so when If ever I feel like not reading I can pick that one up , one I'm reading right now is Project Hail Mary One book should be non fiction , the bill gates type lol , One I am reading rn is How The World Really Works Personally the one's I love the most are stories that teach something valuable or at least makes me question everything I ever believed in. For eg. I would always pick up Kafka over Project Hail Mary I thoroughly enjoyed Sapiens on my first read cuz it checks all the boxes for me even though It is surrounded with controversy and false predictions but everything is composed so well just what I expect in a good book. If a book doesn't change u even in the slightest way possible , It isn't worth reading. maybe it made u question everything maybe it made u conscious about ur daily activities maybe it motivated u enough to finally clean ur dishes idk but even the slightest change a book brings to ur life is worth the effort and time taken No book is ever bad by nature I have mostly picked good books , well Is a book good or bad is subjective by nature and by that standard I have only once I like to think have picked a bad book The Autobiography Of A Yogi What a total bogus pseudoscience of a book I don't like to believe in stuff without proof that is all I'll say about this purchase I bought that when I was 16 mis-influenced by an ass of a youtuber (Ranveer allahbadia lol ik ik how could I of all people) I was not on par with my critical thinking skills at the time as much as I am now
I just hope not to repeat such mistakes in future but who's to say Even if I make such a mistake I guess that would what make me human after all A win over the machines in my book lol. `

title: [POEM] The Lad I Use To Be -
excerpt: "So glad I wrote it down / Of what became of me / Now I smile at what made me frown / Oh what a lad I used to be / In search for all these years / Of where my true self was lost..."
imageAlt: The name AGRAJ in a stylized, blocky purple font
contentMarkdown:
` \"So glad I wrote it down
Of what became of me
Now I smile at what made me frown
Oh what a lad I used to be

In search for all these years
Of where my true self was lost
Now I hold back all these tears
Oh he was never even mine to call cost

Though the past was etched in sorrow
A lesson it did teach
Cherish that is left hoping for a better tomorrow
To forget all the cleft and battles out of my reach\" `

title: [POEM] Winter Is Warm -
excerpt: "The only season with so much warmth / Whispers of wind , a shiver so forth / Bringing us close , holding love and affection / Mornings so lazy , yet so cozy and full of perfection..."
imageAlt: Circular logo with 'agraj' written multiple times in purple curves
contentMarkdown:
`
\"The only season with so much warmth

Whispers of wind , a shiver so forth

Bringing us close , holding love and affection

Mornings so lazy , yet so cozy and full of perfection

Heart races through love  , so it does by the breeze

Sparks a change , a moment to seize

Fills me with drive , softly it fades

As January bows to February's warm shades\"  
`

title: [POEM] Sinnloses leben (Meaning Worthless Life) -
excerpt: "As a kid I used to dream / Of all things mighty and high / Of things way beyond my reach / To fly way above the sky / That I'd grew up to be the greatest alive / To conquer all that is hidden from sight..."
imageAlt: Abstract purple and black logo with the letters AG
contentMarkdown:
` \"As a kid I used to dream
Of all things mighty and high
Of things way beyond my reach
To fly way above the sky
That I'd grew up to be the greatest alive
To conquer all that is hidden from sight

But the first lesson life did ever teach
Was to abandon all hope and dream
And to start the chase
For all that life really is ; a mere race
Pick up the pace for u know nothing
Destined to lose fore' u even took a swing

All they deemed it as right and I ran along
Thought their certainty couldn't be wrong
So I ran and ran and ran all along
Opting for the road and all that is unseen
Maybe this is what life's supposed to Mean

Time passed by without a snooze
All along this way
Never had what I set out to choose
But better yet I never tried
To seek myself , to find my true stride

For the time will run out and u will never be told
That the World might shift beyond ur Leech
Within yourself though , u will always find ur true self to reach

Life's come full circle now only for me to see -
All went away for nothing and all I am now is who I was never supposed to be\" `

title: [POEM] Fragmented Void -
excerpt: "Would love to cry my heart out at the moment / But I can't / I can't do it without you / I am not strong enough to keep livin up / Without you / Lost / Just like I lost all my hope..."
imageAlt: The name 'agraj' in lowercase purple letters with a slight wave effect
contentMarkdown:
` \"Would love to cry my heart out at the moment
But I can't
I can't do it without you
I am not strong enough to keep livin up
Without you
Lost
Just like I lost all my hope
Where are you and I need you the most

Dreadness
Dead from inside
Without you by my side
Got no way to run but all my feelings to hide

Darkness
What's the point keeping them eyes open
Closed I see heaven breathin
Seepin it's way through
Calling me out
Shouting my name
Where I really belong
Other than your warmth and embrace

Suicide
You decide
If I should ever let go this worthless life of mine
Without you this life isn't worth my time

Hopeful
We will be together forever
When I meet you in the next life
It is worth pulling the trigger
It is worth seeking you out
If I can't have you
Then I don't wanna have myself\" `

title: THE FOUR BURNER THEORY -
excerpt: FOUR BURNER THEORY: IMAGINE FOUR BURNERS WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FUEL LEFT... HEALTH... WORK... FAMILY... SOCIAL... IF YOU WANT TO BE SUCCESSFUL THEN YOU HAVE TO CUT DOWN ANY ONE BURNER TOTALLY...
imageAlt: Diagram illustrating the Four Burner Theory with icons for Family, Friends, Health, and Work
contentMarkdown:
`

FOUR BURNER THEORY

IMAGINE FOUR BURNERS WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FUEL LEFT EACH BURNER IDICATE BASIC NECESSITY OF YOUR LIFE . THE FIRST BURNER SHOWS HEALTH . THE SECOND ONE SHOWS WORK . THE THIRD ONE SHOWS FAMILY AND THE LAST ONE SHOWS SOCIAL (MEANS YOUR FRIENDS , NEIGHBOURS ETC. ) AS THE BURNER ONLY HAVE LIMITED FUEL THE BURNERS ARE BURNING EQUALLY THAT MEANS YOU ARE GIVING EQUAL TIME TO EVERYONE TO YOUR FRIENDS , FAMILY , WORK , HEALTH .THIS TYPE OFLIFE IS LIVED BY AN UNSUCCESSFUL ONE AN AVERAGE PERSON, WHO IS GIVING EQUAL AMOUNT OF FUEL TO EACH BURNER.
IF YOU WANT TO BE SUCCESSFUL THEN YOU HAVE to CUT DOWN ANY ONE BURNER TOTALLY FROM YOUR LIFE IT COULD BE ANY BURNER EXCEPT FOR WORK (IT'S OBVIOUS HOW COULD YOU BE SUCCESFUL IF YOU DON'T PAY ATTENTION TO YOUR WORK??) AND IF YOU WANT SUCCESS IN AN EXTREME WAY THEN YOU SHOULD CUT DOWN TWO BURNERS TOTALLY FROM YOUR LIFE THEN ONLY YOU COULD ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN A GREAT WAY LIKE OTHER SUCCESSFUL PEOPLE FOR EG. ELON MUSK , STEVE JOBS ETC. ANALYSE THIER LIFE YOU WILL FOUND THE SAME THING THAT THEY HAVE CUT ANY TWO BURNERS COMPLETELY FROM THIE LIFE .
THANKS FOR GIVING ME YOUR PRECIOUS TIME / HOPE YOU FOUND THIS BLOG KNOWLEDEGABLE IF YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE CLICK HERE !!!✌✌
`
